sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis explains the material elements of the compensation of the Companys named executive officers and describes the objectives and principles underlying the Companys executive compensation program and decisions made in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, our named executive officers are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Michael B. Polk, Chief Executive Officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ralph Nicoletti, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John K. Stipancich, Former Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mark S. Tarchetti, President;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiona C. Laird, Executive Vice President, Chief Human Resources and Communications Officer; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: William A. Burke, III, Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Newell Rubbermaids acquisition of Jarden last year more than doubled the annual sales of the Company resulting in the new, combined enterprise, Newell Brands.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The transformative nature of the acquisition and the value creation opportunity for shareholders requires a highly experienced and highly capable executive team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Polks revenue responsibility increased from $6 to $16 billion in estimated annual sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Burke and Mr. Tarchetti assumed expanded roles in an enterprise of significantly increased size and scope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nicoletti and Ms. Laird were recruited to the Company to lead their respective functions based on more than 30 years each of relevant functional and business experience, leading complex organizational transformations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This past year was one of the most transformational in its history, as the Company extended its successful operating model across a broader set of categories as a result of the combination with Jarden that was completed on April 15, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jarden is a global consumer products company with brands such as Yankee Candle , Crock-Pot , FoodSaver , Mr. Coffee , Oster , Coleman , First Alert , Rawlings , Jostens , K2 , Marker , Marmot , Vlkl  and many others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This transformative combination created a global consumer goods company named Newell Brands with estimated annualized sales of $16 billion and a portfolio of leading brands in large, growing, unconsolidated, global markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The scaled enterprise is expected to accelerate profitable growth with leading brands in a global market that exceeds $100 billion and with business and capability development supported by the efficiencies of the combined company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 2016 through 2021, the Company expects to realize approximately $1.3 billion in annualized cost savings from both Project Renewal and cost synergies related to the Jarden acquisition, driven by efficiencies of scale and new efficiencies in procurement, cost to serve and infrastructure that the combination unlocks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Driving a transformation of this magnitude required a tremendous amount of time and effort from our executive team and from other members of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite the distraction caused by the merger process and subsequent integration efforts, the management team remained focused on the Companys strategic initiatives and financial objectives for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This continued focus translated into solid overall financial and operating performance for 2016, including the following significant highlights:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net sales of $13.26 billion in 2016, an increase of 124.2% in 2016 as compared to 2015, and core sales growth of 3.7% in 2016 as compared to 2015
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For an explanation of core sales and normalized EPS, and a reconciliation of these non-GAAP financial measures to net sales and reported earnings per share, please see Appendix A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reported diluted earnings per share of $0.34 in 2016 compared with $0.05 in 2015 and normalized diluted earnings per share of $2.89 in 2016 compared with $2.18 in 2015, a 32.6% increase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company generated approximately $1.83 billion in operating cash flow and paid down $2.05 billion in debt since the acquisition of Jarden on April 15, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Completed a comprehensive strategic assessment of the Company and launched a new corporate strategy, the New Growth Game Plan, that makes sharp choices on portfolio composition, prioritizes investment in the categories with the greatest potential for growth, and extends the Companys advantaged brand development, design, and e-commerce capabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The new strategy led to the following actions that have already been taken:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Completed the previously announced divestiture of its Dcor business, including Levolor  and Kirsch  window coverings and drapery hardware business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entered into an agreement to sell the Tools business for an estimated price of $1.95 billion, subject to working capital adjustments, which closed on March 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committed to plans expected to divest several other businesses and brands, including the Winter Sports business (Vlkl  and K2  brands) the Zoot  and Squadra  brands; the heaters, fans, and humidifiers business; the Rubbermaid  consumer storage totes business; the Lehigh business (primarily ropes, cordage and chains); the firebuilding business; and the stroller business under the Teutonia  brand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entered into an agreement to acquire the WoodWick  candle business, which closed in January 2017 and entered into an agreement to acquire New Zealand-based Sistema Plastics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Designed and implemented the consolidation of 32 business units to 16 operating divisions and the creation of a new integrated one-company US selling organization at retailers representing about 50 percent of the U.S. sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the three-year period ending December 31, 2016, the Companys total shareholder return (TSR) as determined under the Companys Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP), which includes dividends, was 51.76%, placing it 9th out of the group of 21 companies in the 2014 custom comparator group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Companys stock price significantly outperformed both the S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average (the DJIA) over the same three-year period, with the Companys stock price rising 44.0%, compared to 21.1% and 19.2% for the S&P 500 and the DJIA, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the Companys performance in 2016 and its three-year relative TSR results, the Companys 2016 Management Cash Bonus Plan (the Bonus Plan) and the performance-based restricted stock units (RSUs) granted in 2014 paid out at 143.6% and 120% of target, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Program Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Motivate executives to meet or exceed Company performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of an executives total compensation is directly tied to achieving the Companys performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Organizational Development & Compensation Committee (the Committee) reviews the performance goals and modifies them as appropriate to reflect the Companys current business objectives and strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward individual performance and contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The individual performance evaluation of each executive officer, together with the executives contribution to Company performance, generally affects most aspects of each executives compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the Committee typically considers individual performance in determining an executives annual salary, which, in turn, impacts the amount of incentive compensation that the executive could have earned for meeting or exceeding annual performance goals under the Bonus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the CEO considers the individual performance of his direct reports when recommending any adjustments to the grant value for equity awards made to the executive under the LTIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Link the financial interests of executives and stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Committee used performance-based RSUs to provide long-term incentive compensation and to link the financial interests of the Companys executives with those of its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract and retain the best possible executive talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Successful recruiting and retention of talented executives requires the Company to provide competitive compensation opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To do that, the Company obtains information about compensation practices of its relevant competitors, and in 2016, the Company used compensation information compiled from its 2016 custom comparator group and published survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Policies and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that the compensation program includes key features that align the interest of the named executive officers and the long-term interest of stockholders and are good corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do      What We Dont Do       Align pay with performance       100% of named executive officer annual equity awards are performance- based       Balance short-term and long-term incentives       Cap annual and long-term incentive awards       Require named executive officers to own a meaningful amount of Company stock       Maintain a compensation recoupment policy       Maintain anti-hedging and anti-pledging policies for executive officers       Use an independent compensation consultant that reports directly to the Committee          Provide automatic or guaranteed base salary increases       Provide income tax gross-ups apart from relocation       Re-price stock options       Reward executives with little link to performance       Beginning 2017, pay dividend equivalents on RSUs prior to vesting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determination of Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summarized in the table below are roles and responsibilities of the parties that participate in, or have been delegated authority with respect to, the development of the Companys executive compensation program:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approves any severance agreements, change in control agreements or similar agreements between the Company and its executive officers other than the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Board Members          Approve the CEOs annual compensation, including salary, bonus and long-term incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee Consultant Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assists the Committee in reviewing the effectiveness and competitiveness of the Companys executive compensation programs and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Makes recommendations regarding executive compensation programs consistent with the Companys business needs, pay philosophy, market trends, and the latest legal and regulatory considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides market data as background to decisions regarding CEO and senior executive base salary and annual and long-term incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advises the Committee regarding executive compensation best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintains independence by providing no other services to the Company (the Committee has evaluated its relationship with Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. and has determined that no conflict of interest exists with respect to the services Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. provides to the Committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO          Recommends to the Committee, in the case of other executive officers, base salary amounts, equity awards as well as potential adjustments to incentive awards based on individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participates in the development of annual Company performance goals under the Bonus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Executives          The CEOs management team plays a prominent role in gathering information for, and by participating in meetings of, the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO works with the Executive Vice PresidentChief Human Resources and Communications Officer regarding recommendations on base salary amounts, annual target bonus and equity awards for executives other than the CEO using competitive market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Financial Officer assists in developing recommendations on annual performance goals and determining whether financial performance goals were attained by the Company under the Bonus Plan and LTIP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making compensation decisions, the Committee considers a number of factors including competitive market data, individual and Company erformance, skills, experience, complexity and criticality of role and internal pay equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not use a predetermined formula to make its verall decisions but takes into account all the above factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in deciding each performance-based component of compensation for the Companys amed executive officers, generally including annual incentive and long-term incentive compensation, the Committee in 2016 tied payment to normalized arnings per share, core sales growth, normalized EBITDA and TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such performance goals are intended to align the majority of each executive officers ompensation with stockholders interests over the near and long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 annual meeting of stockholders, the advisory vote on executive compensation was approved by approximately 91.5% of shares voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered this level of approval to indicate the support of the vast majority of the Companys stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company periodically obtains information on the compensation practices of companies in both the custom comparator group and general industry and compares the Companys executive compensation components to that data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Company also used compensation information compiled from published compensation surveys, including surveys from Willis Towers Watson and Aon Hewitt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These surveys provide a larger pool of data for a more statistically relevant comparison of compensation levels and pay practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the portion of total compensation that is equity or cash; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Setting Compensation Opportunity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each element of the compensation program complements the others and, together, is intended to achieve the Committees principal compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When decisions about compensation for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an executive officer are made, the impact on the total value of all these elements of compensation for the individual is considered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually reviews a summary report, or tally sheet, which identifies each element of the compensation paid to each executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses the summary report to review the overall pay and benefit levels and provide additional perspective on how the executive compensation program meets the Companys compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For executives, the Committee reviews competitive market data and establishes target total direct compensation opportunities (i.e., salary, annual incentive and annual long-term incentive targets) based on the following factors: individual performance, breadth of the executives responsibility, strategic importance of the position, internal pay equity, competitive market data, the circumstances surrounding the executives initial hiring or promotion to a position with increased responsibilities and the desire to promote executive retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Summary Compensation Table shows the compensation of each named executive officer for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Total Compensation amount shown on the Summary Compensation Table differs from what the Committee views as relevant to its decisions about executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, while retirement benefits constitute a key component of the competitive compensation package offered to executives, and the design and cost of these programs and the benefits they provide are carefully considered, retirement benefits are not viewed as a meaningful measure of annual executive compensation due to the numerous variables involved in, and volatility associated with, calculating their present value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As in previous years, the Committee approved LTIP grants in 2016 for executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the unique circumstances in 2016 related to the Jarden acquisition, special consideration was given to the timing of the awards to promote maximum alignment between executive compensation and shareholder interests, which we believe to be tied primarily to a successful integration and value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, awards were granted in May 2016, after the closing of the Jarden acquisition, as opposed to February, the month in which LTIP grants are typically made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 LTIP awards were determined on the basis of a share value of $44.19, which was the closing stock price on April 14, 2016, the date immediately preceding the closing date of the Jarden acquisition, in order to better link the executives to the success of the transaction and integration of Jarden.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By the time the awards were actually granted in May 2016, the share price had appreciated to $48.41, and the valuation factor for the awards, based on our anticipated relative TSR performance, was 130% of that grant date stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This share price appreciation translated to actual award values in the Summary Compensation Table being significantly higher than the target value of awards as assessed by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, as a result of the acquisition of Jarden, which more than doubled the Companys revenue, several executives received significant promotions and substantial increases in responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we recruited two named executive officers that had significant experience which we believe was critical to the success of the integration of Jarden and execution of the Companys strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Committee extended new or revised compensation terms to such individuals as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Several executives received sign-on bonuses and special equity grants to reflect their promotion, new hire or additional responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In support of our pay for performance philosophy, 100% of these special equity grants were performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mix of Pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To reinforce the Companys pay for performance philosophy, generally more than 85% of targeted total direct compensation for each named executive officer is contingent upon performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, total direct compensation fluctuates with the Companys financial results and share price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes this approach motivates executives to consider the impact of their decisions on stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To increase alignment with Company performance, executives receive performance-based RSUs (rewards TSR performance relative to the custom comparator group).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overlapping performance cycles for the performance-based RSU awards are designed to incentivize sustainable long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, each of the named executive officers received 100% of the value of his or her LTIP award in performance-based RSUs.

sentences.text: Consideration of Individual Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the Companys annual performance evaluation process, the CEO and each named executive officer establish that individuals performance objectives for the coming year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These performance objectives are not specifically weighted or otherwise intended to be rigid or formulaic, but rather serve as the framework upon which the CEO evaluates the executive officers overall performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEOs evaluation of an executive officers performance relative to these objectives involves a high degree of judgment based on the CEOs observations of, and interaction with, the executive throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No single performance objective is material to the CEOs evaluation of the executive officers performance; however, these performance goals, which reinforce alignment of Company and stockholder interests, are critical to the evaluation of each named executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEOs evaluation of individual performance is considered when he recommends to the Committee, in the case of other executive officers, base salary amounts, annual incentive payout amounts and equity grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the beginning of the year, the Committee recommends to the independent members of the Board the CEOs individual performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees method of evaluation of the CEOs performance is substantially similar to that used by the CEO to evaluate the other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, the CEOs performance objectives are not specifically weighted or otherwise intended to be rigid or formulaic, but rather serve as the framework upon which the Committee evaluates the CEOs performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees evaluation of the CEOs overall performance relative to these objectives involves a high degree of judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No single performance objective is material to the Committees evaluation of the CEOs performance; however, these performance goals, which reinforce alignment of Company and stockholder interests, are critical to the CEO evaluation.

sentences.text: The Committee and Board also take into consideration the CEOs performance when developing his base salary increase, annual incentive payout amounts and long-term incentive grant value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Polks base annual salary, which had not been increased since joining the Company in 2011, was increased in 2016 from $1,200,000 to $1,350,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His target bonus remained at 150% of his salary in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board determined that his 2016 LTIP award should be 861% of his base salary compared to 750% of base salary in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing the CEOs performance, the Board determined the increase in his annual salary and LTIP award to be appropriate in light of: (1) the transformative nature of the acquisition of Jarden, which resulted in the Company growing from approximately $6 billion to $16 billion in annualized sales; (2) the Companys ability to successfully deliver on its 2015 financial commitments during a period of significant organizational and strategic change resulting from the implementation of Project Renewal, the Growth Game Plan and the Jarden acquisition; and (3) the increase in shareholder value that occurred in 2015, as the Companys stock price increased 15.7%, compared to an increase of 14.1% in the 2015 custom comparator group, and decreases of 0.7% in the S&P 500 and 2.25% in the DJIA.

sentences.text: Grant Policies and Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys practice has been to make annual equity awards and award other incentive compensation to named executive officers at the time of regularly scheduled meetings of the Board of Directors or the Committee in February of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the timing of the Jarden Acquisition, in 2016 annual equity awards were made in May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On occasion, the Company makes additional grants to named executive officers, typically in connection with their hiring or promotion or for retention purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys policy is that, except for new hires and certain promotions, all equity awards to named executive officers will be made only at quarterly meetings of the Committee or the Board of Directors, which closely follow the release of the Companys quarterly or annual financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) in the Boards view, the executive engaged in fraud or willful misconduct that was a significant contributing cause to the need for the restatement, and

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Officers and Outside Directors are expected to maintain ownership of Company stock equal to the following applicable market value:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO    6 times annual salary President, COO, CFO    4 times annual salary Other Management Committee Members    3 times annual salary Outside Directors (including Chairman of the Board)    5 times annual cash retainer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until the ownership level is met, executives are required to retain 75% of the net after-tax shares received from stock option exercises and the vesting of RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares held directly or beneficially, including time-based RSUs and performance-based RSUs for which all performance criteria have been satisfied but have not yet vested due to time-based vesting requirements and shares of Company stock allocated to executives accounts under the Newell Rubbermaid 401(k) Savings and Retirement Plan, count toward attainment of these targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unexercised stock options and other unvested performance-based RSUs are not counted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides its eligible executives with retirement benefits that are in addition to those provided to its employees generally in order to provide competitive benefits and assist in attracting and retaining key executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These retirement benefits also apply to named executive officers using the Newell Brands Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (SERP) and/or the SERP Cash Account feature of the Newell Rubbermaid Inc. 2008 Deferred Compensation Plan (2008 Plan), depending upon the executives employment date and participation date in these plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the executive was a participant in the SERP before January 1, 2007 (namely, Mr. Burke), the executive participates in both the SERP and 2008 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the executive was not a participant in the SERP before January 1, 2007 (namely, Messrs. Polk, Nicoletti and Tarchetti and Ms. Laird), the executive participates only in the 2008 Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2013, the Company, upon recommendation of the Committee, amended both the SERP and the 2008 Plan in order to: (1) align the retirement benefits provided by these plans with market practice; (2) simplify and harmonize the operation of the plans; (3) provide consistent levels of benefits among executives; and (4) stabilize the cost of the plans by reducing volatility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although these changes will result in some incremental costs as the Company transitions to the amended provisions, the Company expects that the changes will reduce the annual expense of these plans by over 10% when fully implemented by the end of 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the SERP, the executive accrues an annual benefit at age 65 equal to a target percentage of his or her average annual compensation, reduced pro rata if credited service is less than 25 years, and offset by benefits under the Newell Rubbermaid Pension Plan (Pension Plan), Social Security and SERP Cash Account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective April 1, 2013, the level of compensation and offsets used to determine benefits to be paid under the SERP were frozen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, executives who participate in the SERP continue to earn service for purpose of benefit accruals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the Jarden acquisition, participants in the SERP, including Mr. Burke, became vested their SERP benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the total projected value of the executives benefits under the revised 2008 Plan and revised SERP was less than 90% of the total projected value of benefits under the prior versions of the plans, the Company provides the executive with a transition benefit in order to make up for the estimated loss in value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary transition benefit is a supplemental contribution to the executives SERP Cash
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Account to be paid annually over a five-year period, with the payment for 2016 representing the fourth of five supplemental contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These supplemental contributions are in addition to the standard annual contribution made to an executives SERP Cash Account, which is generally 6% to 9% of an executives eligible compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The supplemental contribution is based on annual compensation without regard to the IRS maximum compensation limit for qualified retirement plans, and such contributions are vested upon payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Listed below are the transition benefits received by Messrs. Polk and Burke for 2016, which were credited to their accounts in March 2017:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive Officer    Transition SERP Cash Contribution as a Percentage of Eligible Compensation Michael B. Polk    11%, or $470,211 William A. Burke    17%, or $292,689
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the supplemental contributions for Mr. Polk is primarily driven by the elimination of the 10% supplemental contribution that he was previously ntitled to because he did not participate in the SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the supplemental contribution for Mr. Burke is primarily driven by the freezing of ompensation and offsets for purposes of calculating benefits under the SERP as well as the change to the definition of compensation used to determine ontributions made to the SERP Cash Account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In each case, the supplemental contribution made to the SERP Cash Accounts is intended to compensate the xecutive for benefits that were expected to be received at retirement prior to the changes in the plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As recently hired executives that had yet to participate in e prior versions of the SERP and 2008 Plan, neither Mr. Nicoletti, Mr. Tarchetti nor Ms. Laird receive any transition benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information regarding the etirement benefits under the SERP and 2008 Plan, see Executive CompensationRetirement Plans, below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers are provided other benefits as part of the Companys executive compensation program which the Committee believes are in line with competitive practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the All Other Compensation column of the Summary Compensation Table and the related footnotes and narrative discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named executive officers participate in the Flexible Perquisites Program, which provides a monthly cash stipend that can be used for the purchase or lease of a personal automobile and related insurance and maintenance, income tax preparation services, estate planning services, financial planning services or other perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Messrs. Nicoletti, Stipancich, Burke and Tarchetti and Ms. Laird received monthly stipends of $1,803 under this program while employed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Polk received a monthly stipend of $3,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Company maintains corporate aircraft primarily for business travel, the Committee believes that it is often in the best interests of the Company from a productivity, safety and security concern that the CEO be permitted to use the aircraft for personal travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to his compensation arrangement, Mr. Polk is limited to personal use up to $165,000 in incremental cost to the Company annually, and any use in excess of such amount in the applicable year results in an equivalent reduction in the payout to be received by him under the Bonus Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Mr. Polks usage in 2016 was less than $165,000, he did not receive any bonus adjustment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other named executive officers may use the corporate aircraft for personal travel on a limited basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional benefits for the named executive officers include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company contributions to the Newell Rubbermaid 401(k) Savings and Retirement Plan (401(k) Plan), including Company contributions that match employee deferrals as well as retirement savings contributions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: payment of life and long-term disability insurance premiums;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual health examinations encouraged by the Company; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assistance for a new hire or transfer necessitating relocation, which includes reimbursement of various relocation expenses, a relocation allowance, a bonus for an early sale of the executives home and tax assistance on certain taxable reimbursed expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) limits the deductibility of executive compensation paid to the CEO and to each of the three other most highly compensated officers (other han the chief financial officer) of a public company to $1 million per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, compensation that is considered qualified performance-based ompensation generally does not count toward the $1 million deduction limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual salary does not qualify as performance-based compensation under ection 162(m) due to its nature.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts paid under the Bonus Plan and equity awards subject to Company performance criteria generally qualify as fully eductible performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any equity awards (other than stock options) with vesting provisions that are not based on Company performance riteria are not likely to qualify as performance-based compensation and therefore may not be fully deductible by the Company when the restrictions lapse and he shares are taxed as income to an executive officer while he or she is subject to Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects that the majority of compensation to amed executive officers, including awards under the Bonus Plan, the exercise of stock options and the vesting of annual performance-based RSU awards will e deductible for federal income tax purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers the tax deductibility of executive compensation as one factor to be considered in the context of its overall compensation philosophy and objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee will not necessarily limit executive compensation to amounts deductible under Section 162(m), since the Committee desires to maintain the flexibility to structure compensation programs that attract, retain and motivate the best possible executive talent and meet the objectives of the Companys executive compensation program, and to enhance stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Annual Compensation Opportunity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As outlined above, in 2016 the Company completed the transformative acquisition of Jarden, which more than doubled the size of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual compensation of the Companys existing executives was increased to reflect the additional roles and substantial increase in responsibilities, and the Company hired additional executives with the experience necessary to successfully complete an integration and manage an enterprise of this magnitude.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Summarized below is the 2016 annualized target compensation opportunity for the NEOs which reflects the promotion increases and the arrangements with the Companys new executives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Hire and Promotion Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nicoletti received a one-time lump sum new hire bonus of $1,900,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event Mr. Nicoletti voluntarily terminates his employment with the Company within the first 12 months of his employment, he is required to reimburse the Company for 100% of the new hire bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also received an additional 62,735 performance-based RSUs on his hire date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The new hire cash and equity awards were primarily intended to replace compensation forfeited when he left his prior employer, including foregone equity and annual incentive payments, and to provide immediate alignment to Newell Brands and our shareholders objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Laird received a one-time lump sum new hire bonus of $750,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event Ms. Laird voluntarily terminates her employment with the Company within the first 12 months of her employment, she is required to reimburse the Company for 100% of the new hire bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also received an additional 78,419 performance-based RSUs on her hire date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The new hire cash and equity awards were primarily intended to replace compensation forfeited when she left her prior employer, including foregone equity, annual incentive payments and retirement-related compensation, and to provide immediate alignment to Newell Brands and our shareholders objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as summarized under Long-Term Incentive Compensation above, in part to recognize his increased responsibilities as President of the Company, the Committee awarded Mr. Tarchetti 124,463 additional performance-based RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such performance-based RSUs, as well as those granted to Mr. Nicoletti and Ms. Laird, included expense management targets related to Project Renewal and the Jarden integration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Polks compensation arrangement provides that, in the event he is involuntarily terminated prior to a change in control (except for good cause or a violation of the Companys Code of Business Conduct and Ethics) or resigns for good reason (as such terms are defined in his Employment Security Agreement), he will be entitled to the following benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) salary continuation payments for two years, but with all remaining payments paid in a lump sum by the March 15th after the year of termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a lump sum cash payment for COBRA continuation of medical and dental coverage for two years equal to the difference between the COBRA premium and coverage rates for active employees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a pro-rata portion of his annual cash bonus under the Bonus Plan for the year of termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) vesting of the balance of his SERP Cash Account (including interest accrued thereon); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) a one year window to exercise the stock options awarded to him in July 2011 in connection with his hiring.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that Messrs. Nicoletti, Tarchetti, Burke or Ms. Laird is terminated for any reason other than good cause (as defined in their respective offer letters), the executive will be entitled to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) receive severance pay of 52 weeks of weekly base compensation (subject to applicable limits in the Companys Severance Plan for Executives in Bands 10 and above (the Severance Plan) payable in a lump sum no later than 60 days after termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) receive other benefits in the Severance Plan that run concurrently with the severance pay such as a COBRA subsidy and outplacement services;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) receive the executives management cash bonus prorated by a fraction, the numerator of which is the number of days in the fiscal year in which the date of termination occurs through the date of termination and the denominator of which is 365, paid out subject to the satisfaction of applicable performance criteria at the same time as management bonuses are paid to employees generally, but no later than March 15  of the following year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) retain a pro-rated portion of the executives unvested stock options or RSUs, which shall continue to vest according to their original respective vesting dates; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v), with respect to Messrs. Nicoletti and Tarchetti and Ms. Laird, receive any unvested portion of their respective Project Renewal and integration related equity awards granted in 2016, which shall vest upon satisfaction of the performance criteria applicable to the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if Mr. Burke is terminated without cause prior to April 15, 2019, or retires on April 15, 2019, then he will retain all of his stock options and RSUs that will vest within the 36-month period following such termination, all of which shall continue to vest pursuant to their original vesting schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to receive these benefits, the executive will be required to sign a separation and release of claims agreement that contains confidentiality, non-solicitation and non-competition obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of the executives termination following a Change-in-Control (as such term is defined in the respective Employment Security Agreement described below), the executive will not receive benefits under their respective compensation arrangement, and severance benefits will be determined in accordance with the executives Employment Security Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the executive may elect to waive his or her right to receive benefits under his or her Employment Security Agreement and elect to receive benefits under their respective compensation arrangement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Security Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has Employment Security Agreements (ESAs) with its executives, including the named executive officers and certain key employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESAs provide severance benefits following certain terminations of employment occurring within two years of a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESAs do not contain tax gross up provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, payments and benefits payable to the executive will be reduced to the extent necessary if doing so would result in the executive retaining a larger after-tax amount, taking into account the income, excise and other taxes imposed on the payments and benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the caption Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control of the CompanyTermination of Employment Following a Change in ControlEmployment Security Agreements below for a discussion of the terms of the ESAs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that the protections afforded by the ESAs are a valuable incentive for attracting and retaining top managers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It believes that the ESAs are particularly important because the Company does not generally have employment agreements or long-term employment arrangements with its executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company also believes that, in the event of an extraordinary corporate transaction, the ESAs could prove crucial to the Companys ability to retain top management through the transaction process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company believes that the benefits provided under the ESAs represent fair and appropriate consideration for the agreement of the executives to the restrictive covenants in the ESAs that prohibit them from competing with the Company and from soliciting Company employees for 24 months following a termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits provided under the ESAs were determined to be at levels appropriate and competitive with the benefits provided under similar arrangements of companies in the Companys comparator group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, with the assistance of its independent compensation consultant, continues to monitor best practices with respect to ESAs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains the Newell Rubbermaid Severance Plan (the Severance Plan), the purpose of which is to provide continuation of base salary and health care benefits for a period of time in order to assist the former employee to transition to new employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligibility for benefits is conditioned on an employee incurring an involuntary termination of employment under certain circumstances and agreeing to sign a general release of claims and to abide by certain non-competition, non-solicitation and confidentiality provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Severance Plan applicable to the named executive officers, an employee who is eligible may receive salary continuation for the greater of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) three weeks for each year of service or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 52 weeks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of salary continuation is limited to two times the lesser of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) an employees annual compensation for the year prior to the termination or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the maximum amount that may be taken into account under a qualified retirement plan pursuant to Section 401(a)(17) of the Internal Revenue Code for the year of termination ($265,000 for 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employee may also receive medical coverage under COBRA until the earlier to occur of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) nine months after termination of employment or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the date the employee is no longer eligible to participate in the group medical plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such coverage would be subsidized by the Company at the then existing active employee rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that appropriate severance benefits are important to attracting and retaining talented executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stipancich Separation Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On May 12, 2016, the Company and John K. Stipancich, the Companys former Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, entered into a separation agreement and general release (the Separation Agreement) pursuant to which he agreed to a customary release and restrictive covenants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Separation Agreement entitled Mr. Stipancich to: (1) a lump sum severance payment of $618,000; (2) his pro-rated annual cash incentive award under the 2016 Management Bonus Plan assuming performance at target level, or $372,087; (3) continued vesting of restricted stock unit grants that would have otherwise vested within two years after his termination of employment, which will vest on their original vesting dates (subject to the satisfaction of any applicable performance conditions); (4) a distribution of his SERP Cash Account of $1,162,312; and (5) certain other benefits, including continued medical coverage for 52 weeks and accrued but unused vacation of $25,606 and a cash payment of $15,000.

sentences.text: No named executive officer received payments from the SERP or Pension Plan during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SERP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP is intended to offer competitive benefits to attract and retain executive talent and covers executives who were participants prior to January 1, 2007 (namely, Mr. Burke).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gross Benefit Formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP calculates a gross pension benefit payable at Normal Retirement Date (age 65) prior to applying certain benefit offsets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The gross SERP benefit formula for Mr. Burke is a monthly benefit equal to 1/12  of 67% of average compensation for the five consecutive years in which it was highest, reduced proportionately if years of credited service are less than 25.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective April 1, 2013, the level of compensation and offsets used to determine benefits to be paid under the SERP were frozen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, Mr. Burke will continue to earn service for purposes of benefit accruals and vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation for purposes of the gross SERP benefit formula generally includes base salary and management cash bonus amounts, paid prior to April 1, 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, for Mr. Burke, the amount of bonus compensation for 2006 and through March 31, 2013, generally was adjusted to equal the amount that would have been received by him under the bonus plan in effect for 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Social Security and Pension Benefit Offsets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The gross SERP benefit of each executive is reduced by Mr. Burkes monthly primary Social Security benefit and Pension Plan benefit at age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The offset for the Pension Plan benefit is based on his marital status (i.e., a joint and 50% survivor annuity if married and a single life annuity if not married), includes the benefit the executive would have accrued by April 1, 2013 if the Company had not frozen new enrollment and benefit accruals under the Pension Plan effective December 31, 2004 and is applied without regard to his vested status in any actual Pension Plan benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SERP Present Value, Cash Account Offset.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Burkes gross SERP benefit, as reduced by his foregoing Social Security and Pension Plan benefit amounts, is converted to a lump sum present value amount as of January 1st following the year of his termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actuarial assumptions for this purpose are based on the discount rate and mortality assumptions used by the Company in its Form 10-K for pension expense reporting purposes for the year of Mr. Burkes termination of employment, except using a unisex mortality table and without reduction for mortality risk before age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The lump sum amount is then reduced (to not less than zero) by the full balance as of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: April 1, 2013 (both vested and unvested amounts) of his SERP Cash Account under the 2008 Plan accumulated with earnings through the January 1st after the year of his termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remaining SERP balance (if any) is transferred to his SERP Cash Account under the 2008 Plan, for the payout described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit Entitlement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the acquisition of Jarden in April 2016, Mr. Burke became vested in his SERP benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time and Form of Benefit Payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Burke will receive his SERP benefit at the same time and in the same form as payment of his SERP Cash Account under the 2008 Plan (i.e., a lump sum or in annual installments not to exceed ten years).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payment or commencement of the SERP benefit will be in the year after the year of Mr. Burkes termination of employment, but not sooner than six months after the date of such termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Forfeiture Events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Burke will forfeit the SERP benefit if his employment is terminated due to fraud, misappropriation, theft, embezzlement or intentional breach of fiduciary duty, he competes with the Company in the areas that it serves, he makes an unauthorized disclosure of trade or business secrets or privileged information, he is convicted of a felony connected with his employment or he makes a material misrepresentation in any document he provides to or for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assumptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assumptions used in calculating the present value of the accumulated benefit under the SERP are set forth in Footnote (2) to the 2016 Pension Benefits table above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Plan is a tax-qualified pension plan covering all eligible U.S. employees of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Plan was amended to cease future benefit accruals and to suspend the addition of any future participants for non-union employees, including the named executive officers, beginning on January 1, 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, among the named executive officers, only Mr. Burke is a participant in the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit Formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to Mr. Burke, benefits were accrued at the rate of 1.37% of compensation not in excess of $25,000 for each year of service plus 1.85% of compensation in excess of $25,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the Pension Plan, compensation generally includes regular or straight-time salary or wages, up to the applicable Internal Revenue Code limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Burke does not earn any additional pension benefits after December 31, 2004, however, he continues to earn years of service for vesting and early retirement eligibility purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Burke is not yet eligible for a normal or early retirement benefit under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, since he has completed five years of service, he is eligible for a deferred retirement benefit following termination of employment, beginning at age 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Burke will become eligible for a reduced early retirement benefit at age 60 if he terminates employment with at least 15 years of vesting service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Form of Benefit Payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit formula calculates the amount of benefit payable in the form of a monthly life annuity, which is the normal form of benefit for an unmarried participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The normal form of benefit for a married participant is a joint and 50% survivor annuity, which provides a reduced monthly amount for the participants life with the surviving spouse receiving 50% of the reduced monthly amount for life.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assumptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assumptions used in calculating the present value of accumulated benefits under the Pension Plan are set forth in Footnote (2) to the 2016 Pension Benefits table above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 401(k) Savings and Retirement Plan

sentences.text: Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control of the Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides certain additional benefits to eligible employees upon certain types of termination of employment, including termination of employment following a change in control of the Company or only upon a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All named executive officers are eligible for benefits under these circumstances as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination of Employment Following a Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Security Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has entered into ESAs with each current named executive officer, as well as with certain other key employees, to provide benefits upon certain terminations of employment following a change in control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESAs provide for benefits upon either of two types of employment termination that occur within 24 months after a change in control of the Company:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) an involuntary termination of the executives employment by the Company without good cause; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a voluntary termination of employment for good reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the ESAs, a change in control generally means:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) a person acquires 25% or more of the voting power of the Companys outstanding securities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) a merger, consolidation or similar transaction that generally involves a change in ownership of at least 50% of the Companys outstanding voting securities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) a sale of all or substantially all of the Companys assets that generally involves a change in ownership of at least 50% of the Companys outstanding voting securities; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) during any period of two consecutive years or less, the incumbent directors cease to constitute a majority of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, good cause exists under the ESAs if the executive in the performance of his or her duties engages in misconduct that causes material harm to he Company or the executive is convicted of a criminal violation involving fraud or dishonesty.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, good reason exists under the ESAs if there is a material diminution in the nature or the scope of the executives authority, duties, rate of pay or incentive or retirement benefits; the executive is required to report to an officer with a materially lesser position or title; the Company relocates the executive by 50 miles or more; or the Company materially breaches the provisions of he ESA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, good reason will not exist if the Companys reduction in benefits under an incentive or retirement plan is applicable to all other plan participants who are senior executives and either (1) the reduction is a result of an extraordinary decline in the Companys earnings, share price or public image or (2) the reduction is done to bring the plan(s) in line with the compensation programs of comparable companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits provided upon such a termination of employment include the following (which are quantified in the table that follows this discussion):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A lump sum severance payment equal to the sum of: (1) two times (three times in the case of Mr. Polk) the executives annual base salary, (2) two times (three times in the case of Mr. Polk) the executives bonus under the Bonus Plan and (3) a pro-rata portion of the executives bonus under the Bonus Plan for the year of the executives termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All benefits under the SERP and the 2008 Plan (to the extent applicable to the named executive officer) become fully vested and the equivalent of the unvested portion of the executives benefits under the 401(k) Plan shall be paid in a lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Company stock options held by the executive will become immediately exercisable and remain exercisable until the earlier of three years thereafter or the remaining term of the options; all restrictions on any Company restricted securities and RSUs held by the executive will lapse; and all performance goals on Company performance-based awards will be deemed satisfied at the target level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued medical coverage provided in the form of subsidized COBRA coverage that extends generally for 24 months, coverage under all other welfare plans generally for 24 months, outplacement services for six months and the payment of certain out-of-pocket expenses of the executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No gross-up payment will be made to cover any excise and related income tax liability arising under Sections 4999 and 280G of the Internal Revenue Code as a result of any payment or benefit arising under the ESA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the ESAs provide for a reduction in amounts payable so that no excise tax would be imposed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, a reduction in payments will not occur if the payment of the excise tax would produce a greater overall net after-tax benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESAs contain restrictive covenants that prohibit the executive from (1) associating with a business that is competitive with any line of business of the Company for which the executive provided services, without the Companys consent and (2) soliciting the Companys agents and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These restrictive covenants remain in effect for two years following any termination of the executives employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Severance Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described above under the caption Compensation Discussion and AnalysisSeverance Plan, the Company has a severance plan that provides benefits to non-union employees, including the named executive officers (except for Mr. Polk), who are involuntarily terminated without cause due to a plant closing, layoff or reduction in force, or other similar reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Severance Plan applicable to the named executive officers, an employee who is eligible may receive salary continuation for the greater of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) three weeks for each year of service or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) 52 weeks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of salary continuation is limited to two times the lesser of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) an employees annual compensation for the year prior to the termination or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the maximum amount that may be taken into
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: account under a qualified retirement plan pursuant to Section 401(a)(17) of the Internal Revenue Code for the year of termination ($265,000 for 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employee may also receive medical coverage under COBRA until the earlier to occur of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) nine months after termination of employment or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the date the employee is no longer eligible to participate in the group medical plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such coverage would be subsidized by the Company at the then existing active employee rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2010 Stock Plan and 2013 Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following applies to stock options and RSUs issued under the 2010 Stock Plan and the 2013 Incentive Plan upon termination of employment, retirement generally and under the Companys retirement guidelines, death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options: In general, if an individuals employment terminates for any reason other than death, disability or retirement, then all of his or her options expire on, and cannot be exercised after, the date of his or her termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the individuals employment terminates due to death or disability, then all outstanding options fully vest and continue to be exercisable for one year following his or her termination (or the expiration of the term of the option, if earlier).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the 225,872 stock options awarded to Mr. Polk in 2011 pursuant to his compensation arrangement (all of which vested in 2014), in addition to the above, if he is involuntarily terminated (except for good cause or violation of the Companys Code of Business Conduct and Ethics); voluntarily terminates his employment for good reason; or if he retires after he reaches the age of 55 and has at least five years of service, then all such outstanding options would continue to be exercisable for one year following his termination (or the expiration of the term of the option, if earlier).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the sum of his age and years of service a retirement is at least 65 but less than 70, his options remain exercisable for five years following his termination (or the expiration of the term of the option, if earlier), and if the sum of his age and years of service at retirement is at least 70, his options remain exercisable for 10 years following his termination (or the expiration of the term of the option, if earlier).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock Units (RSUs): In general, if a named executive officers employment terminates for any reason other than death, disability or retirement, then his or her RSUs that have not yet vested are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the named executive officers employment terminates due to death or disability, then all restrictions lapse, and all RSUs fully vest, on the date of his or her termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to RSUs granted in 2014, 2015 and 2016, if the individuals employment terminates due to retirement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) at age 60 or later; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) at age 55 or later with at least ten years of service, any unvested time-based and performance-based RSUs granted more than 12 months prior to the date of retirement will be pro-rated by dividing the full number of months worked since the grant date by 36.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pro-rated awards will be paid out at the end of the original vesting schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any RSUs granted less than 12 months from the date of retirement will be forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the compensation arrangements for each of Messrs. Tarchetti, Burke, and Nicoletti and Ms. Laird provide for continued vesting of all or a prorata portion of RSUs upon involuntary termination without cause or, in Mr. Burkes case, retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Compensation Discussion and AnalysisTermination Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Provisions: The Board of Directors may condition the grant of an equity award upon the executive entering into one or more agreements with the Company not to compete with, or solicit the customers or employees of, the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, in the event of termination of the executives employment with the Company generally without cause, the Board has the discretion to accelerate the date as of which any stock option may become exercisable or to accelerate the date as of which the restrictions will lapse with respect to RSUs or other awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, additional provisions may apply under the terms of the executives individual award letter.

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is appointed annually by the Board of Directors and currently consists of five members, all of whom are independent directors for purposes of the Audit Committee under the applicable U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) regulations, the applicable NYSE rules and the Companys Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the Board of Directors has affirmatively determined that each of Mr. Strobel, Mr. Todman and Mr. Viault is qualified as an audit committee financial expert within the meaning of the applicable SEC regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee fulfills its responsibilities through periodic meetings with the Companys independent registered public accounting firm, internal auditors and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Committee met 12 times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee acts under a written charter which was most recently approved by the Board of Directors on November 12, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the Committees current charter is available under the Corporate Governance link under the Investor Relations tab on the Companys website at www.newellbrands.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees the Companys financial reporting process on behalf of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has the primary responsibility for the preparation, presentation and integrity of the Companys financial statements, for establishing and maintaining internal control over financial reporting and for assessing the effectiveness of the Companys internal control over financial reporting as of the end of each fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys independent registered public accounting firm is responsible for planning and carrying out a proper audit of the Companys annual financial statements and the Companys internal control over financial reporting, expressing opinions as to the conformity of the financial statements with generally accepted accounting principles and the effectiveness of internal controls over financial reporting, based on its audits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee discussed with the Companys internal auditors and its independent registered public accounting firm the overall scope and plans for their respective audits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee meets with the internal auditors and representatives of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm, with and without management present, to discuss the results of their examinations, their evaluations of the Companys internal controls, and the overall quality of the Companys financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fulfilling its oversight responsibilities, the Committee reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements in the Annual Report with management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviewed and discussed with representatives of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm their judgments as to the quality, not just the acceptability, of the Companys accounting principles and underlying estimates in its financial statements, and the matters required to be discussed by PCAOB Auditing Standard No. 16, Communications with Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has received from the independent registered public accounting firm the written disclosures regarding their independence required by PCAOB Rule No. 3526, Communication with Audit Committees Concerning Independence, as currently in effect, and has discussed with representatives of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm the firms independence from management and the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, the Committee has received written confirmations with respect to non-audit services performed by the independent registered public accounting firm and has considered whether such non-audit services are compatible with maintaining the firms independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the reviews and discussions referred to above, the Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the audited financial statements be included in the Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 to be filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also reviewed managements report on its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016 and the report of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm on the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the above-mentioned review and discussions with management and the Companys independent registered public accounting firm, the Committee recommended to the Board that managements report on its assessment of the effectiveness of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016 and the report of the independent registered public accounting firm be included in the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016 to be filed with the SEC.
